1.content:
The first thing you knew, and the only thing you have ever known, is the bright white void before you. You find the spacious emptiness comforting and warm, like a womb. You're unsure how long you've been here, but you feel as if it has been a long time.

You stretch your arms and legs and yawn. You feel like you've just woken up from a long nap. Everything feels fuzzy.

You blink a few times and shake your head. It's a very strange sensation for sure, yet you feel familiar with it. In fact, it's less like a fuzzy feeling and more like a tugging feeling all over your body. It's not painful at all, very gentle in fact.

After taking a few moments to feel it out, you decide to move, or float, in the direction you're being "pulled" to.

As you move further and further into the white nothingness, the tugging feeling gets stronger, or maybe clearer. You can only assume that you're getting closer to the source.

After a short time, the sensation reaches what feels like its climax. It changes from the feeling of being pulled and instead into a warm hug.

A figure slowly fades in before you. A small white dragon, slightly shorter than you. It's arms are wrapped firmly around your sides and it has its cheek resting against your chest. It seems satisfied.

"Didn't think I'd find you first, Lost Soul."

The little dragon removes its arms from around your sides and steps back a bit, looking over your form.

"I'm Poficent. I'm a Resplendent Soul. Do you have a name you go by, or are you still undecided?"

The little dragon tilts its head at you, seemingly eager to learn more about you. Though this opens up a bit of a conundrum for you. Your name has been the last thing on your mind since you've "woken up."

Poficent notices your confusion and smiles.

"It's alright if you don't have a name yet. I didn't come up with one until a week after I woke up."

The dragon reaches out one of its clawed, scaly hands to you in a friendly manner.

"Why don't you come with me for now and we can worry about that later? Assuming you want to of course." Poficent gives a small smile after saying that last part.

You stare at the dragon in thought.
1.title: It all begins here

11.content:
You tentatively touch Poficent's hand, fully expecting it to be rough due to the scales, but it was surprisingly soft and unsurprisingly warm.

You both gently wrap your fingers around the others hand and shake. You're not quite sure why you both shook hands. You weren't exactly making a deal or anything. At least, you hope you weren't.

You let your hand drop to your side and watch as Poficent turns around.

"You might wanna cover your eyes."

Suddenly, your vision is completely overcome with an even bright white light. You can't see Poficent in front of you, nor can you even see your own hands covering your face.

Just when you think your eyes are about to burn out of their sockets, the light fades and you are in complete darkness.

You blindly reach your hands out in front of you and grab onto something hard and smooth with each hand.

"Ah, those are my horns. Here, let me make it a little brighter in here."

You hear a faint fwoosh as a small fire flows out of Poficent's mouth and lights a few candles.

"That better?"

You nod as you remove your hands from the dragon's horns.

Now that you have some light, you can see the details of the room, or rather, the cave.

It's not just your typical dank, wet cave. It fairly well furnished and clean looking. You know, for a cave.

Poficent idly scratches their side as they sit cross-legged on the floor.

"So I'm sure you probably have at least a few questions, correct?"

You shrug. You feel like a newborn baby, to be perfectly honest. An explanation would be pretty nice.

"Well, take a seat wherever you like and feel free to ask as many questions as you need. We've got all the time in the world, Lost Soul."

Poficent places their hands in their lap and watches you as you walk over to what looks like a chair made out of rocks.

You sit in the chair and are pleasantly surprised to find that it's much more comfortable than it looks.

Poficent fidgets with the scales on their leg as they patiently wait for you to ask your questions.
11.title: Dragon Companion

info.brief_description: You are a rare Lost Soul, simply trying to find your place in the universe.
info.description:
If you wish to add, then please read this first!

Basic Information About Souls:

Common Soul - Your typical run of the mill life form, depending on the universe. They make up most of the inhabitants in any Resplendent Soul's universe. Once they die, their souls are absorbed by their respective Resplendent Soul. Automatically created by the universe, if allowed by a Resplendent Soul.

Exceptional Soul - Similar to a Common Soul, but their souls persist in their universes version of the afterlife. Created by a Resplendent Soul.

Divine Soul - An Exceptional Soul chosen and transformed by a Resplendent Soul to help watch over their universe. Their abilities are decided by their Resplendent Soul upon creation. Created by a Resplendent Soul. Capable of travel between universes if accompanying a Resplendent Soul.

Resplendent Soul - Literally a god. Capable of literally anything. They hold the power to shape existence itself. They're still people, of course. That doesn't stop some of them from getting massive egos. Unkillable. Evolves from a Lost Soul. Capable of travel between universes.

Lost Soul - Can become a Resplendent Soul, should they find and join with their other half. While they can die, they will continuously be reborn either forever, or until they become a Resplendent Soul. Lost Souls will lose their memory upon rebirth, but will regain all memories for as long as they stay dead. Inexplicably wills itself into existence. Only two can ever exist at any time. Lost Souls are polar opposites of each other in terms of personality and beliefs. Capable of travel between universes via Universal Warp Gate.

Basic Character Information:

There are currently only nine Resplendent Souls; Ada, Too, Poficent, Toby, Jack, Anna, Gar, Itsy, and Little.

Ada - Frequently changes forms, though tends to appear as human most often. Mother figure to Poficent. Always cool, calm, and collected. Believes there is a purpose for everything and that all life is equal. Lets her universe live on its own with very little intervention.

Poficent - Usually takes the form of a little white dragon, approximately two inches of size. Very protective of Too. Very bubbly and loving to most she meets. Believes there is no purpose for anything and that all life is equal. Frequently alters and interacts with her universe as well as others.

Too - Holds the form he evolved with, a seventeen year old male human who looks very feminine. No strong feelings toward anyone. Easily enraged when tensions run high, but otherwise mostly unemotive. Very neutral in his beliefs. Lets his universe live on its own, intervening as needed.

Toby - Frequently pretends he's a demon. Very Close friends with Jack and Gar. Quick to anger and physical assault. If he doesn't like it, it doesn't matter to him. Helps Gar with his universe.

Jack - Will use whatever form he thinks will work best with his currently planned prank. Close friends with Toby and Gar. Mostly chill and laid back. Everything is a joke to him. Frequently interacts with his universe.

Anna - Holds the form of a blue will-o'-the-wisp. Extremely close friends with Little. Kind and Caring. Would throw her life on the line for the people she loves, if that actually meant anything. Frequently interacts with her universe.

Gar - Holds the form of a bipedal turtle. Close friends with Toby and Jack. Quick to anger, but would never deal physical harm to another living being. Very neutral in his beliefs. Lets his universe live on its own with minimal intervention.

Little - Holds the form of a red panda. Extremely close friends with Anna. Reacts slowly and has a sleepy personality. She tries to just go with the flow. Frequently interacts with her universe.

For the most part, they all keep to their own little groups. They rarely interact with one another outside of that, but it does happen.
